arm_group.description: 2 portions of FFP will be transfused prior to reperfusion
2 portions of non-frozen plasma will be transfused prior to reperfusion

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators want to measure the degradation of the endothelial glycocalyx before and
      after clamping the aorta, in patients operated for a abdominal aortic aneurism.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Glycocalyx in Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm

detailed_description.textblock:
50 patients is scheduled for enrollment. Blood samples will be up taken before surgery, 10
      min after reperfusion, at the end of surgery and the following morning. In addition the
      investigators are placing a renal venous catheter where blood samples will be up taken as
      mentioned above for the analysis of endothelial markers together with markers for kidney
      damage.

      The first 10 patient will act as part of a pilot study, where only measurement of the
      endothelial and renal failure markers will be performed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  above 18 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  prior engagement in scientific study within the last 30 days.

intervention.description: 2 Units of plasma transfused equvilant to 2 times 275ml
intervention.other_name: Fresh frozen plasma versus fresh non-frozen plasma

clinical_study.official_title: Measurement of the Endothelial Function in Patients With a Abdominal Aortic Aneurism.

other_outcome.description: Development of kidney- and respiratory failure and sepsis

overall_official.affiliation: Section for Transfusion Medicine, Capital Region Blood Bank, Rigshospitalet, Copenhagen, Denmark.

primary_outcome.description: Measurement of endothelial markers peri- and postoperative: thrombomodulin, E-selectin and syndecan-1

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
